item.title: Trump Signs Bill That Allows States To Deny Funding To Planned Parenthood
item.description: April 14, 2017 - Earlier this week, President Trump signed a bill that could encourage states to withhold federal money from Planned Parenthood. Opponents say it will have a big impact on women's health.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - Earlier this week, President Trump signed a bill that could encourage states to withhold federal money from Planned Parenthood. Opponents say it will have a big impact on women's health. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/14/523997009/trump-signs-bill-that-allows-states-to-deny-funding-to-planned-parenthood

item.title: How A Budget Squeeze Can Lead To Sloppy Science And Even Cheating
item.description: April 14, 2017 - The hypercompetitive world of biomedical research occasionally drives scientists to cheat. More often, scientists make decisions that undercut their results. That can lead colleagues astray.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - The hypercompetitive world of biomedical research occasionally drives scientists to cheat. More often, scientists make decisions that undercut their results. That can lead colleagues astray. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/14/523786179/how-a-budget-squeeze-can-lead-to-sloppy-science-and-even-cheating

item.title: A Family Of Ebola Fighters: 'With God's Help, We Made It'
item.description: April 14, 2017 - It's the third anniversary of the Ebola pandemic; 2014 was a catastrophic year. But one family in Liberia gave health workers a reason to celebrate.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - It's the third anniversary of the Ebola pandemic; 2014 was a catastrophic year. But one family in Liberia gave health workers a reason to celebrate. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/04/14/523437067/a-family-of-ebola-fighters-with-gods-help-we-made-it

item.title: Michigan Doctor Charged With Performing Female Genital Mutilation On Girls
item.description: April 14, 2017 - The Department of Justice says it believes this is the first case brought under a federal law that criminalizes the practice, which is widely condemned as a human rights violation.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - The Department of Justice says it believes this is the first case brought under a federal law that criminalizes the practice, which is widely condemned as a human rights violation. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/14/523917425/michigan-doctor-charged-with-performing-female-genital-mutilation-on-girls

item.title: Navy Tells Sailors To Leave The E-Cigarette On Shore
item.description: April 14, 2017 - At least 15 "mishaps" have resulted in injuries or damage, the Navy says. The new policy bans the devices on ships, submarines, aircraft, boats, craft and heavy equipment.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - At least 15 "mishaps" have resulted in injuries or damage, the Navy says. The new policy bans the devices on ships, submarines, aircraft, boats, craft and heavy equipment. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/14/523296216/navy-tells-sailors-to-leave-the-e-cigarette-on-shore

item.title: Maps Show A Dramatic Rise In Health Insurance Coverage Under ACA
item.description: April 14, 2017 - The overall increase in the number of Americans with health insurance draws attention to counties where the uninsured rate is still high, many of them in states that chose not to expand Medicaid.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - The overall increase in the number of Americans with health insurance draws attention to counties where the uninsured rate is still high, many of them in states that chose not to expand Medicaid. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/14/522956939/maps-show-a-dramatic-rise-health-in-insurance-coverage-under-aca

item.title: Is Yellow Fever Knocking At Our Door?
item.description:
April 14, 2017 - An outbreak in Brazil isn't slowing down as predicted. Dr. Anthony Fauci calls it "a potential threat" to the U.S.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/04/14/523312856/is-yellow-fever-knocking-at-our-door
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: This Week In Race: A House That Flew Over The Ocean And A Man Who Didn't Get To Fly
item.description:
April 14, 2017 - You could say it's been a pretty turbulent week on the race beat.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/codeswitch/2017/04/14/510965856/this-week-in-race-a-house-that-flew-over-the-ocean-and-a-man-who-didnt-get-to-fl

item.title: Get Set For Trump Revisions To Your Affordable Care Act Insurance
item.description: April 13, 2017 - The Trump administration has finalized a rule that will make big changes in Obamacare health plans and eligibility as soon as this summer. Will it stabilize the insurance marketplace, too?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 13, 2017 - The Trump administration has finalized a rule that will make big changes in Obamacare health plans and eligibility as soon as this summer. Will it stabilize the insurance marketplace, too? http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/13/523569821/get-set-for-trump-revisions-to-your-affordable-care-act-insurance

item.title: A New Approach To Helping Men Of Color Heal After A Violent Incident
item.description: April 13, 2017 - To figure out the best ways to help young black and Latino men heal, a nonprofit will train young men in New York City to conduct interviews with other young men of color.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 13, 2017 - To figure out the best ways to help young black and Latino men heal, a nonprofit will train young men in New York City to conduct interviews with other young men of color. http://www.npr.org/sections/codeswitch/2017/04/13/523746277/a-new-approach-to-helping-men-of-color-heal-after-a-violent-incident

item.title: What Doesn't Kill You Can Maim: Unexpected Injuries From Opioids
item.description: April 13, 2017 - Emergency room doctors are just beginning to study a new kind of casualty in the opioid epidemic — patients who survive an overdose, but walk away with brain damage, kidney failure or dead muscle.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 13, 2017 - Emergency room doctors are just beginning to study a new kind of casualty in the opioid epidemic — patients who survive an overdose, but walk away with brain damage, kidney failure or dead muscle. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/13/523452905/what-doesnt-kill-you-can-maim-unexpected-injuries-from-opioids

item.title: On The Navajo Nation, Special Ed Students Await Water That Doesn't Stink
item.description: April 12, 2017 - Fundraising is underway for a new filtration system at an Arizona school for Navajo children with disabilities. Now, the water runs black and smells like rotten eggs, but is technically safe to drink.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 12, 2017 - Fundraising is underway for a new filtration system at an Arizona school for Navajo children with disabilities. Now, the water runs black and smells like rotten eggs, but is technically safe to drink. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/12/523303559/on-the-navajo-nation-special-ed-students-await-water-thats-doesnt-stink

item.title: No Ant Left Behind: Warrior Ants Carry Injured Comrades Home
item.description: April 12, 2017 - Don't call it empathy, scientists say. These termite-eating ants only retrieve injured comrades on the way home from a hunt, not before. But the hurt ants do recover better at home — to fight again.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 12, 2017 - Don't call it empathy, scientists say. These termite-eating ants only retrieve injured comrades on the way home from a hunt, not before. But the hurt ants do recover better at home — to fight again. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/12/523313734/no-ant-left-behind-warrior-ants-carry-injured-comrades-home

item.title: What Happens To A Congressman's Health Insurance If Obamacare Goes Down?
item.description: April 12, 2017 - Under the Affordable Care Act, most members of Congress and staff who want to buy health insurance must buy it on the exchange. That requirement is not affected by bills aimed at replacing the ACA.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 12, 2017 - Under the Affordable Care Act, most members of Congress and staff who want to buy health insurance must buy it on the exchange. That requirement is not affected by bills aimed at replacing the ACA. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/12/523335954/what-happens-to-a-congressmans-health-insurance-if-obamacare-goes-down

item.title: Civilians With Severe Burns Treated At Texas Military Hospital
item.description: April 11, 2017 - The U.S. military's burn center in San Antonio is responsible for treating service members who are badly burned. But, to stay sharp, the medical teams there also treat civilians.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 11, 2017 - The U.S. military's burn center in San Antonio is responsible for treating service members who are badly burned. But, to stay sharp, the medical teams there also treat civilians. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/11/521003804/civilians-with-severe-burns-treated-at-texas-military-hospital
